intro: Ghiesbreghtia mollis, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and prefers well-drained soil. Ghiesbreghtia mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
